crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt"; flow:to_server,established; http_header; content:"Host:",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/^Host\x3a\s*(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\s*:?\s*\d*\s*$/ims"; service:http; reference:url,www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec15.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:50447; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: FILE-IDENTIFY Ultimate Packer for Executables/UPX v0.62-v1.22 packed file magic detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET $FILE_DATA_PORTS -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"FILE-IDENTIFY Ultimate Packer for Executables/UPX v0.62-v1.22 packed file magic detected"; flow:to_client,established; file_data; content:"|8A 06|F|88 07|G|01 DB|u|07 8B 1E 83 EE FC 11 DB|"; pcre:"/^(\x72\xED\xB8\x01.{3}|\x8A\x07\x72\xEB\xB8\x01\x00\x00\x00)\x01\xDB\x75\x07\x8B\x1E\x83\xEE\xFC\x11\xDB\x11\xC0\x01\xDB[\x73\x77].{3}\x8B\x1E\x83\xEE\xFC/R"; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; service:ftp-data,http,imap,pop3; reference:url,upx.sourceforge.net; reference:url,www.microsoft.com/whdc/system/platform/firmware/PECOFF.mspx; classtype:misc-activity; sid:16435; rev:18; )

attributes.magic: Bourne-Again shell script, ASCII text executable

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a curl process start on linux, which indicates a file download from a remote location or a simple web request to a remote server

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The script attempts to ensure execution in a writable directory by sequentially trying to change the current working directory to common temporary or system locations. For each of multiple listed CPU architectures, it attempts to download a binary from a remote server (81.94.156.24/hiddenbin/) using `wget` or `curl`. The downloaded file is then copied to a file named 'WTF', made executable, and subsequently executed. This process is repeated for fifteen different architectures.
